results.title: Henry Bolte speech at opening of relocated Dandenong Stock Market (1958)
results.brief_description:
Silent film footage of the then Premier of Victoria, Henry Bolte, presenting his speech at the opening of the Dandenong Stock Market at its new location in Cheltenham Road (1958). Includes scenes of dignitaries and spectators, and a tour of the stockyards.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
THIS FILM IS SILENT

results.title: Dandenong
results.brief_description: A walk down memory lane in this black and white 1950s footage of the Dandenong Trades Exhibition which includes shots of white goods, furniture and TVs, Holden cars, streetscape images and a fashion parade. Also shows a blind woman working swiftly to create a bristle scrubbing brush. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
results.description: A walk down memory lane in this black and white 1950s footage of the Dandenong Trades Exhibition which includes shots of white goods, furniture and TVs, Holden cars, streetscape images and a fashion parade. results.title: Billycarts
results.brief_description: This evocative silent home movie footage shows kids playing in a billycart in the drive-way and on the street, and creates a strong nostalgia for long ago youth. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: The Astronomer
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Kate McCartney
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation, “The Astronomer” is the story of an old timekeeper who, little by little, loses sense of his world. It is a quiet rumination on time, progress and disconnection, the delicate threads that forge identity and the ease with which we can be forgotten.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Kate McCartney

results.title: A Monster's Voyage
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Morag Porteous
results.brief_description:
A young girl and her loyal friend are on a voyage together. While they are self-sufficient and happy, nothing can stay the same forever. This artistically creative short animation expresses emotion and feeling in its story-telling and has a mythical quality of legends and folklore. Use of strong colours and hand-drawn animation.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.

results.title: A young girls journey to the other side of the world
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Maria Sourtzis
results.brief_description: This is a story of migration through the eyes of a young girl. Maria recounts the long journey by boat, the memories of Bonegilla migrant reception centre and her early life in Melbourne.
results.title_for_label: A young girls journey to the other side of the world
results.description: This is a story of migration through the eyes of a young girl. Maria recounts the long journey by boat, the memories of Bonegilla migrant reception centre and her early life in Melbourne.

results.title: The Story of an immigrant filmmaker
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Agnes Karlik
results.brief_description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.
results.description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.
